p: Moringa oleifera seed has a high proportion of monounsaturated/saturated fatty acids (MUFA/SFA), sterols and tocopherols, as well as proteins rich in sulphur amino acids [ 32]. As reported in previous studies, Moringa oleifera seed oils (also called Behen oil, which is the commercial name given to Moringa oleifera oil) have similar fatty acid content and physicochemical parameters to those reported for other vegetable oils and can be considered as a healthy alternative to hydrogenated oils in food formulations. The main fatty acids present in Moringa oleifera oil are behenic, linoleic, stearic, palmitic, oleic, arachidic, linolenic, eicosenoic and heptadecanoic acids [ 25], with oleic acid being the main unsaturated fatty acid, with 73.5% in the seed oil [ 33]; carbohydrate content is 27.5% [ 27]. The seeds are a rich source of Ca and Mg, respectively [ 25, 34].
